block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 620 Eighth Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10018; or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
FOR CHILDREN

Hoboken Family Nights: Singalong with Yosi. Tuesday at 7 p.m. Free. Shipyard Park, 13th Street and Constitution Way. (201) 420-2207. Newark ''Fun on a String,'' puppets and marionettes. June 23 at 11 a.m. Free. Clinton Branch, Newark Public Library, 739 Bergen Street. (973) 733 -7754. Newark The Lizard Guys, a look at exotic animals. June 23 at noon. Free. Madison Branch, Newark Public Library, 790 Clinton Avenue. (973) 733-8090. Newark ''The Last Dragon on Earth,'' presented by the Crabgrass Puppet Theater. June 23 at 11 a.m. Free. Springfield Branch, Newark Public Library, 50 Hayes Street. (973) 733-7736. Newark The Lizard Guys, a look at exotic animals. June 23 at 10 a.m. Free. Weequahic Branch, Newark Public Library, 355 Osborne Terrace. (973) 733-7751.
COMEDY

Newark ''The King and Young King Comedy Tour,'' with Steve Harvey. Through June 17. Sold out. New Jersey Performing Arts Center, 1 Center Street. (888) 466-5722. Red Bank Lily Tomlin. June 23 at 8 p.m. $38 to $125. Count Basie Theater, 99 Monmouth Street. (732) 842-9000.
FILM

Hoboken ''An Inconvenient Truth,'' documentary with Al Gore. Wednesday at 9 p.m. Free. Pier A Park, Frank Sinatra Drive and First Street. (201) 420-2207. New Brunswick The New Jersey Film Festival, Summer 2007. Schedule and information: njfilmfest.com. Through Aug. 23. $4 to $10. New Jersey Media Arts Center, 72 Lipman Drive. (732) 932-8482.
MUSIC AND DANCE

Hamilton ''Music Under the Stars'': Folk by Association. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. $5 and $8, including park admission. Grounds for Sculpture, 18 Fairgrounds Road. (609) 586-0616. Hoboken Summer ''Enchanted Evenings'' Concert Series: Cabaret Night. Monday at 7 p.m. Free. ''Bubble Performs the Beatles,'' tribute to the Beatles. Thursday at 7 p.m. Free. Frank Sinatra Park, Frank Sinatra Drive, between Fourth and Fifth Streets. Madison Annual Giralda Lawn Concert, with the New Jersey Symphony and a picnic; presented by the Arts Council of the Morris Area. June 24 at 4 p.m. $4 to $10. Giralda Farms, Dodge Drive and Madison Avenue. (973) 285-5115, Extension 18. Marlton Patrick Karwarn, singer-songwriter. Friday at 8 p.m. Free. Borders, 515 Route 73 South. (856) 985-5080. Morristown Hot Soup and Carl Zebooker, folk. Friday at 8:30 p.m. $7. Minstrel Coffeehouse, Morristown Unitarian Fellowship, 21 Normandy Heights Road. (973) 335-9489. Newark Taino Caribbean Carnival Celebration. June 23 at 11 a.m. Free. Branch Brook Branch, Newark Public Library, 235 Clifton Avenue. (973) 733-6388. Newark ''Spotlight on Newark's Youth Choirs.'' Wednesday at 6 p.m. Free. Weequahic Branch, Newark Public Library, 355 Osborne Terrace. (973) 733-7751. Ocean Grove Kenny Vance and the Planotones, J. T. Carter, the Passions and the Harptones; doo-wop. June 23 at 7:30 p.m. $23 and $28. The Great Auditorium, Pilgrim and Ocean Pathways. (732) 988-0645. Princeton ''Around the World,'' international programs series: ''Rosewood and Rhythm,'' jazz by Jeff Ausfahl, Argentinean guitarist, and his World Jazz Trio. Monday at 7:30 p.m. Free. The New Jersey Opera; summer preview concert. Friday at 7 p.m. Free. Princeton Public Library, 65 Witherspoon Street. (609) 924-9529. Princeton Summer concert series, presented by the Arts Council of Princeton: Animus. Thursday at 6 p.m. Free. Princeton Shopping Center, 301 North Harrison Street. (609) 921-6234. Red Bank ''High School Musical,'' performed by Phoenix Productions. Through June 17. $22 to $29. Old Crow Medicine Show, country and folk. Thursday at 8 p.m. $25 and $35. Wilco. Friday at 8 p.m. Sold out. Count Basie Theater, 99 Monmouth Street. (732) 842-9000. Ridgewood ''Summer Sing,'' by the Pro Arte Chorale. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Christ Church, Cottage Place and Franklin Avenue. (201) 445-9052. Ridgewood Greg Caldarone, popular and Italian standards. Tuesday at 8:30 p.m. Free. The Bobby Byrne Show, Broadway show tunes. Thursday at 8:30 p.m. Free. Kasschau Memorial Shell, Veteran's Field behind the Ridgewood Library (125 North Maple Avenue). (201) 444-1776. Stanhope Willie Porter, singer and songwriter; with Walt Bibinger, jazz guitarist. Thursday at 8 p.m. $15. Stanhope House, 45 Main Street. (973) 347-0458. Teaneck Steve Kimock, with the Jacob Fred Jazz Odyssey, rock. Wednesday at 9 p.m. $20. The New Mastersounds, rock. Thursday at 9 p.m. $20. Marshall Crenshaw Trio, rock. Friday at 9 p.m. $25. The Radiators, rock. June 23 at 9 p.m. $30. Mexicali Blues Cafe, 1409 Queen Anne Road. (201) 833-0011. Teaneck Vladimir Tsypin, violinist, and Thomas Osuga, pianist; concert celebrating early 20th-century Jewish music. June 17 at 4 p.m. $10. Puffin Cultural Forum, 20 East Oakdene Avenue. (201) 836-8923. West Windsor The New Jersey Opera; summer preview concert. June 23 at 7:30 p.m. Free. Nassau Park Pavilion, Nassau Park Boulevard (off Route 1).
OUTDOORS

East Rutherford State Fair Meadowlands, with rides, performers, food, games, exhibits and shopping. Thursday through July 8. $2.95 to $9, not including rides. Giants Stadium, The Meadowlands. (973) 450-1070. Milford Father's Day celebration, with music, wine tasting, crafts and children's activities. June 17, noon to 5 p.m. Free admission; wine tastings, $5. Alba Vineyard, 269 Route 627. (908) 995-7800. Morristown Vintage baseball game: the Flemington Neshanock Base Ball Club plays against the New York Gothams; with a presentation of ''Casey at the Bat.'' June 23, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Free with admission: $4 to $6. Fosterfields Living Historical Farm, 73 Kahdena Road. (973) 326-7645. Morristown Civil War re-enactment day, with tents, muskets, artillery drills and soldiers in period dress. June 23, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Free with general admission: $2 to $4. Historic Speedwell, 33 Speedwell Avenue. (973) 540-0211.
SPOKEN WORD

Camden Summer Writers' Conference, with readings by James Hoch, Sam Apple, Maura Egan and others. Information and schedule: summer.camden.rutgers.edu/writconf.html. Tuesday through June 27. Free. Fine Arts Complex, Third Street. Hamilton Poetry in the Park: Seventh Annual Poetry Slam, with a contest. June 24 at 2 p.m. $5. Grounds for Sculpture, 18 Fairgrounds Road. (609) 586-0616. New Brunswick Maya Angelou. Monday at 8 p.m. $45 to $105. State Theater, 15 Livingston Avenue. (732) 246-7469. West Windsor ''West Windsor Arts Council Summer Solstice Poetry Six,'' with Mayhem Poets, Laura Boss and an open mike. June 24, 3 to 5 p.m. Free. Nassau Park Pavilion, Nassau Park Boulevard (off Route 1). (609) 919-1982.
THEATER

Atlantic Highlands ''Nunsensations: The Nunsense Vegas Revue,'' musical comedy. Through June 23. $15 to $20. First Avenue Playhouse, 123 First Avenue. (732) 291-7552. Beach Haven ''Thoroughly Modern Millie,'' musical comedy by Dick Scanlan and Richard Morris. Through July 1. $17 to $27. Surflight Theater, Engleside and Beach Avenues. (609) 492-9477. Cape May ''Bad Dates,'' comedy by Theresa Rebeck. Through July 20. $10 to $28. Cape May Stage, Bank and Lafayette Streets. (609) 884-1341. Eatontown ''Crimes of the Heart,'' comedy by Beth Henley, presented by Over the Rainbow. Through June 30. $17 and $22. Eatontown Playhouse, Tower Market Shopping Center, 37-13 Route 35 North. (732) 460-0100. Leonia ''The Playwrights' Showcase,'' a collection of new plays by local playwrights: ''Garlic and Milk,'' by Robert Daria; ''The Inspector General Prepares for a Polygraph,'' by Blair Birmelin; ''God, Satan and Sarah,'' by Cary Glitter; ''The Lindy,'' by Kathleen Clark. Through June 17. $14 and $16. Civil War Drill Hall Theater, 130 Grand Avenue. (201) 947-9606. Long Branch ''Place Setting,'' premiere of the comedy by Jack Canfora. Through June 24. $25 to $40. New Jersey Repertory Company, 179 Broadway. (732) 229-3166. Madison ''The Play's the Thing'' comedy by Ferenc Molnar, adapted by P. G. Wodehouse; with Mark Jacoby. Through July 1. $28 to $52. F. M. Kirby Shakespeare Theater, Drew University, 36 Madison Avenue. (973) 408-5600. Millburn ''Pirates!'' adapted from Gilbert and Sullivan's ''Pirates of Penzance.'' Through July 8. $23.25 to $72.25. Paper Mill Playhouse, 3 Brookside Drive. (973) 376-4343. Morris Township ''A Midsummer Night's Dream,'' a 90-minute version of Shakespeare's comedy, presented by the Shakespeare Theater of New Jersey. Tuesday through July 22. $15 and $30. College of St. Elizabeth Greek Theater, 2 Convent Road (off Route 124). (973) 408-5600. Nutley ''Death of a Salesman,'' Arthur Miller's classic play. Through June 23. $12. Nutley Little Theater, 47 Erie Place (off Brookfield Avenue). (973) 667-0374. Sussex ''Greater Tuna'' by Jaston Williams, Joe Sears and Ed Howard, presented by the Tri-State Actors Theater. Through June 24. $17 to $27. Crescent Theater, 74 Main Street. (973) 875-2950.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

Clinton ''Gregory Perkel: Manuscripts of the Cardboard Culture,'' mixed-media show, with an annual national juried print exhibition and ''Wally Barnette: Recent Work.'' Through Sept. 16. Donation: $3. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Hunterdon Museum of Art, 7 Lower Center Street. (908) 735-8415. Hopewell ''Wall to Wall'' and ''The Delaware at Dusk,'' urban wall art by Barbara K. Suomi, and photographs of the Delaware River by John Blackford. Through July 8. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Gallery 14, 14 Mercer Street. (609) 333-8511. New Brunswick ''Natvar Bhavsar: The Dimensions of Color,'' paintings. ''Through the Night: Children's Book Illustrations From the Rutgers Collection.'' Both through July 22. ''Alone/Together: People in American Prints.'' ''Printmaking From the Soviet Estonia.'' Both through July 29. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Jane Voorhees Zimmerli Art Museum, 71 Hamilton Street. (732) 932-7237. Newark ''Someday This Will All Be (Something Else),'' group landscape show. Through July 14. Hours: Wednesdays, Thursdays and Fridays, noon to 4 p.m.; Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Gallery Aferro, 73 Market Street. Newark ''Mexicana: Discovering Mexican Popular Arts, 1919-1950.'' Through Nov. 25. ''The Art of Glass From Gallé to Chihuly,'' contemporary group show. Through Aug. 5. ''At the Movies: Edward Hopper's 'The Sheridan Theater,' '' exhibition inspired by Hopper's painting of a movie theater. Through Aug. 19. Hours: Wednesdays through Fridays, noon to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m., October through June; noon to 5 p.m., July through September. The Newark Museum, 49 Washington Street. (973) 596-6493. Oceanville ''Sightings: Recent Works by Doug and Mike Starn,'' photography. Through Aug. 5. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Sundays noon to 5 p.m. Noyes Museum of Art, 733 Lily Lake Road. (609) 652-8848. South Orange ''Singularity in the Communal Tide: Culture and Identity in the Moment,'' group show. Through July 15. Curator talk and artist panel discussion: June 24 at 3 p.m. Hours: Fridays through Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Pierro Gallery, 5 Mead Street. (973) 378-7755. Tenafly ''Natural Moments,'' photographs by Itai Monnickendam. Through June 28. JCC on the Palisades, 411 East Clinton Avenue. (201) 569-7900. Trenton ''The Best of the Best and the First Annual Salon des Refusés,'' exhibition of work by regional and Trenton-area artists. Through June 24. $2 to $5. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. The Trenton City Museum, Cadwalader Park. (609) 989-3632.

A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 620 Eighth Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10018; or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
